# excetera

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of `{excetera}` is to provide an extendr-powered R wrapper around the 
`tera` templating-engine in Rust.

## Installation

You can install the development version of excetera like so:

``` r
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("kbvernon/excetera")
```

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:


```{r}
tdir <- tempdir()
cat(
  "<p>Hello {{ x }}</p>",
  file = file.path(tdir, "hello-world.html")
)

cat(
  r"(<img class="{{ img_class }}" src="{{ img_source }}>)",
  file = file.path(tdir, "image-paths.html")
)

bob <- ExTera$new(file.path(tdir, "*"))
```
